sections.name: Dewey Daystar
sections.text: This creature did not include a description.

link.name: Pathfinder #178: Punks in a Powderkeg pg. 46
link.alt: Pathfinder #178: Punks in a Powderkeg pg. 46

link.name: Pathfinder #178: Punks in a Powderkeg pg. 46
link.alt: Pathfinder #178: Punks in a Powderkeg pg. 46

traits.name: Unique
traits.text: A rules element with this trait is one-of-a-kind. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to creatures with this trait is increased by 10.

traits.name: Lawful
traits.text: Lawful effects often manipulate energy from law-aligned Outer Planes and are antithetical to chaotic divine servants or divine servants of chaotic deities. A creature with this trait is lawful in alignment.

traits.name: Leshy
traits.text: A creature with this trait is a member of the leshy ancestry. These small plant or fungus creatures are humanoid in form. An ability with this trait can be used or selected only by leshies. A weapon with this trait is created and used by leshies.

traits.name: Plant
traits.text: Vegetable creatures have the plant trait. They are distinct from normal plants. Magical effects with this trait manipulate or conjure plants or plant matter in some way. Effects that manipulate plants have no effect in an area with no plants.

link.name: Pathfinder #178: Punks in a Powderkeg pg. 46
link.alt: Pathfinder #178: Punks in a Powderkeg pg. 46

automatic_abilities.name: Spiny Body
automatic_abilities.text: A cactus leshy is covered in spines. A creature that Grabs the cactus leshy takes 1d8+3 piercing damage.

automatic_abilities.name: Verdant Burst
automatic_abilities.text: When Dewey Daystar dies, a burst of primal energy explodes from his body, restoring 2d8 Hit Points to each plant creature in a 30-foot emanation. This area fills with cacti, becoming difficult terrain. If the terrain is not a viable environment for the cacti, they wither after 24 hours.

traits.name: Finesse
traits.text: You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier on attack rolls using this melee weapon. You still calculate damage using Strength.

traits.name: Unarmed
traits.text: An unarmed attack uses your body rather than a manufactured weapon. An unarmed attack isn’t a weapon, though has a weapon group and might have weapon traits. An unarmed attack can’t be Disarmed. It also doesn’t take up a hand, though a fist or other grasping appendage generally works like a free-hand weapon.

traits.name: Range
traits.text: These attacks will either list a finite range or a range increment, which follows the normal rules for range increments.

traits.name: Unarmed
traits.text: An unarmed attack uses your body rather than a manufactured weapon. An unarmed attack isn’t a weapon, though has a weapon group and might have weapon traits. An unarmed attack can’t be Disarmed. It also doesn’t take up a hand, though a fist or other grasping appendage generally works like a free-hand weapon.
